column3: I don't think this will cause many conflicts, so I don't mind merging. One thing I'm not sure about is "bitcoin address" or "Bitcoin address". It could be interpreted both as referring the the currency or to the system.\n
For me such an address is a Bitcoin (system) address used to transfer bitcoins :). But we should hear others, too.\n
Just take a look at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitcoin\nThere they write Bitcoin address\n
I'm not sure about Wikipedia beeing a general reference, but they use it the same way I would use it. @sipa What you say?\n
Can we please decide to get this in quick? I want to create the next version of the en translation master file, so that we have enough time for such things to mature!\n

I am not sure what the 'appname' in freedesktop notifications is actually used for. The specification is unclear on this: http://developer.gnome.org/notification-spec/

Using qApp name sounds like a good idea. There's no need to translate it.
Can someone confirm changing this won't have any unexpected side effects?\n

I took a look through the Notificator class and it is used as programName in args.append(programName); It this is the case we should perhaps remove the tr() for this and I change it back to lower-case?`@laanwj Can you help here?\n

I think we should just use `qApp->applicationName()` instead of `tr("bitcoin-qt")`. We use `app.setApplicationName("Bitcoin-Qt");` to set the name, so it should be fine to query it via applicationName()...\n
Updated to use the dynamic solution in favor of a static string as app-name.\n
